sentences: Haav kasvas küll kinni, kuid arm jäi järele.
Tal on põsel, säärel, suu limaskestal, peas, kubemes arm.
context: In Estonian, 'arm' (plural: 'armid') means scar or mark. It refers to a visible trace left after healed tissue damage or wounds. This could be from injuries, operations, burns, or diseases like smallpox. The word can describe various types of scars - large, deep, wide, fresh ones - and their locations on the body.
